riddle: I whisper 'try again' even when you fail. What am I?
I drain your energy and cloud your day. I'm hard to see but hard to fight. What am I?
I fill your eyes but not your lungs. I leave quietly but stay long. What am I?
I make joy seem far, and pain feel near. I whisper failure when success is clear. What am I?

I make joy seem far, and pain feel near. I whisper failure when success is clear. What am I?
I grow when you believe in yourself. I vanish when doubt grows. What am I?
You seek me after pain, and I arrive in peace. What am I?

I can heal or hurt, lift or break. I’m fragile yet strong. What am I?

I begin with understanding and grow with patience. What am I?
I take time and care, not shortcuts. I rebuild what's broken. What am I?
I fill your eyes but not your lungs with water. I arrive without a sound and linger after. What am I?
I am a heavy cloak that you constantly wear, dimming the vibrancy of the world everywhere. What am I?
I settle deep within, a hollow and aching space, where laughter once echoed, leaving not a trace. What am I?
I make joy seem a distant star, and darkness the world where you are. I whisper that things will never mend. What am I, this feeling without end?
I paint the future in shades of despair, a landscape of bleakness beyond all repair. What am I, this vision devoid of all light?
I steal the belief that things can improve, leaving you stuck in a desolate groove. What am I, this thief of all future delight?
I tell you your efforts will always fall flat, that you don't deserve kindness, not even a chat. What am I, this voice that diminishes your light?
I whisper you're a burden, a weight and a strain, that others would be better if you didn't remain. What am I, this lie that erodes your self-esteem?
I convince you your presence makes others feel blue, that you're undeserving of love, honest and true. What am I, this falsehood that isolates your soul?
I weigh down your limbs though no burden you bear. Sleep doesn't erase me; I'm always still there. What am I, this tiredness that won't depart?
I drain all your energy, leaving you slow and weak, making even small tasks a mountain to seek. What am I, this constant depletion of might?
I make your eyelids heavy, your focus unclear, a persistent drowsiness holding you here. What am I, this slumber that offers no rest?
I spin in your mind with endless repeat, of futures uncertain and bitter defeat. What am I, this cycle of 'what if' and fear?
I am the constant chatter, the mental unease, imagining dangers that constantly seize. What am I, this nagging voice filled with doubt?
I build up scenarios, both dreadful and grim, a theater of terrors playing within. What am I, these visions that cause such distress?
I grip at your chest when no danger is nigh, a phantom alarm that makes you just sigh. What am I, this feeling that offers no peace?
I make your palms sweat and your heart start to race, a sense of impending doom you can't quite erase. What am I, this sudden surge of alarm?
I lurk in the shadows of the unknown and vast, a feeling of vulnerability that forever will last. What am I, this chilling sense of unease?
I dissect every word, every glance, every pause, finding hidden meanings and breaking all laws of calm. What am I?
I replay conversations again and again, searching for errors, where could you have been more keen? What am I, this mental review without end?
I turn small decisions into monumental tasks, weighing each option behind fearful masks. What am I, this mental maze with no clear way?
I strike without warning, a sudden intense wave, making your breathing shallow, your courage depraved. What am I?
I bring a rush of terror, a feeling of flight, though safety surrounds you in plain, open sight. What am I, this overwhelming distress?
I make your chest tighten and your vision grow dim, a feeling of losing control from within. What am I, this sudden internal storm?
I am a gentle act you give to your soul, to nurture and heal and make you feel whole. What am I?
I am the quiet moments you set just for you, to recharge your spirit and see a fresh view. What am I?
I am the nourishment you provide to your mind and your frame, honoring your needs, playing your own game. What am I?
I am the strength to rise after every fall, to bend but not break, standing sturdy and tall. What am I?
I am the inner toughness that weathers the storm, emerging stronger, keeping your spirit warm. What am I?
I am the ability to bounce back with grace, finding your footing and setting your pace. What am I?
I am the peace you find in what cannot be changed, releasing the struggle, your spirit un-caged. What am I?
I am the understanding that flaws are a part, embracing your wholeness right from the very start. What am I?
I am the quiet agreement with what simply is true, letting go of resistance, allowing the new. What am I?
I am the small light that flickers in the dark, a belief in a future, leaving my mark. What am I?
I am the quiet knowing that brighter days will arrive, a seed of optimism that keeps dreams alive. What am I?
I am the vision of possibilities yet unseen, a positive outlook, forever serene. What am I?
I am the quiet power that resides deep inside, a wellspring of courage where your dreams can abide. What am I?
I am the unyielding spirit that pushes you through, the quiet confidence that sees your projects anew. What am I?
I am the deep-seated belief in your own capabilities, the unwavering knowledge that overcomes all debilities. What am I?
I am the unwavering focus on the goal you pursue, the refusal to quit, seeing your vision through. What am I?
I am the persistent drive that keeps you on track, never letting obstacles make your efforts slack. What am I?
I am the firm resolve to see things to the end, a commitment unwavering, your steadfast friend. What am I?
I am not the absence of fear, but the will to proceed, to step into the unknown, planting a hopeful seed. What am I?
I am the bravery to try even when doubts may arise, facing the challenge with unwavering eyes. What am I?
I am the boldness to venture beyond what feels safe, to embrace the uncertain with a confident waif. What am I?
I am the sudden spark that ignites your creative fire, a new idea dawning, lifting you higher. What am I?
I am the muse that whispers ideas in your ear, a sudden insight banishing all fear. What am I?
I am the vision that fills you with purpose and zeal, a powerful motivator that makes your future feel real. What am I?
I build invisible walls, though no mortar is laid, pushing away connections, leaving you dismayed. What am I?
I am a heavy weight for mistakes real or perceived, a constant self-blame, deeply conceived. What am I?
I make small annoyances feel like a great fight, a constant tension dimming your light. What am I?
I fill your body with a need to move and pace, an inner discomfort you can't quite erase. What am I?
I make you steer clear of things that cause you distress, limiting your world and causing more stress. What am I?
I demand flawlessness in all that you do, setting impossible standards for me and for you. What am I?
I am the practice of being present and aware, noticing each moment without judgment or care. What am I?
I am the appreciation for the good that you find, a positive focus that eases your mind. What am I?
I am the ability to understand another's plight, to share in their feelings and offer your light. What am I?
I am the belief in your power to handle each task, a sense of competence that's yours if you ask. What am I?
I am the vibrant energy that fuels your endeavor, a passionate spirit that lasts forever. What am I?
I am the first step you take without being told, a proactive spirit, brave and bold. What am I?
I am a hollow feeling inside of your core, a lack of connection, wanting something more. What am I?
I whisper questions about your worth and your skill, eroding your confidence and your inner will. What am I?
I make interactions feel like a perilous stage, a fear of judgment that keeps you encaged. What am I?
I am the recurring ideas that you can't dismiss, creating distress and a constant abyss. What am I?
I am the kindness you offer to your own heart and mind, understanding your struggles, being gentle and kind. What am I?
